result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R. Melland

records.addlTxt:
11:17 AM Cases called: 21CF575, 21CF667, 21CF761, 22CF16 & 22CF118. Defendant Joshua R. Melland not in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Joshua R. Melland.  District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was aware of the date and time of today's hearing. This date was set as a status conference. 

State requests a warrant in all files and asks that a cash bond be ordered. Court orders a warrant with a $5000 cash bond associated with that warrant. Defendant will need to appear in front of Br. 2 to quash the warrant as the Court has previously indicated that further missed appearances would result in a cash bond.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:02 PM cases 21CF575, 21CF667, 21CF761, 22CF16, 22CF118 called. Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua R. Melland in court with Attorney William A. Schembera.

Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas and orders 20 days to file motion.

Status Conference set for 09/26/2022 at 11:30 AM

9:42 AM 21CF575, 21CF667, 21CF761, 22CF16, 22CF118 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua R. Melland in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera not in court. Defendant gives reasoning for his missed appearance. Warrants are quashed. 
State asks for a cash bond with reasoning. Court has a colloquy with the defendant regarding future missed appearances. 
Bond in all files will continue. Court advises if the defendant misses any other court hearings, a significant cash bond will be ordered. 
An ARGN in all files is scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 2:00 PM.

Cases called at 10:30 AM: 21CF575, 21CF667, 21CF761, 22CF16, 22CF118.
Defendant Joshua R. Melland not in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera appeared for Joshua R. Melland.   Attorney Afton Lewis  in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Schembera has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and notes the Defendant was given notice of today's hearing.
Court orders warrants in all cases.

1:34 PM Cases called: 22CF118, 22CF16, 22CF761, 21CF575 & 21CF667 Defendant Joshua R. Melland in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Joshua R. Melland.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in every file and Court accepts waiver. Cases are referred to Br. 2 for scheduling.

9:34 AM cases 22CF118, 21CF575, 22CF16, 21CF667, 21CF761 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua R. Melland appeared in court, Attorney William A. Schembera for Joshua R. Melland appeared in court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with J.W., D.T., L.D., M.V., C.T.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Must reside at S15095 State Road 37, Mondovi, WI 54755 address with his parents, 6am-6pm daily - must be at residence.

(11:10 AM cases 21CF575, 21CF667, 21CF761, 22CF16, 22CF118 called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua R. Melland appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by phone for Joshua R. Melland. 
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint for 22CF118 and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
State requests $3,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson does not make argument.
Court orders $3,000.00 signature bond with conditions after speaking with defendant.
Court orders the defendant to contact Attorney Schembera to see if he still represents the defendant.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on February 21, 2022 at 1:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with J.W., D.T., L.D., M.V., C.T.

Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
